detaileddescription.para: When writing: Set to start a single-conversion
When reading: Bit = 0 when conversion is in progress
When reading: Bit = 1 when device is not performing a conversion
Input multiplexer configuration register mask (default at reset = 0x00)
Programable gain amplifier configuration mask (default at reset = 0x02)
Device operation mode mask (default at reset = 0x01)
Data rate mask for ADS1015 chip (default at reset = 0x04)
Data rate mask for ADS1115 chip (default at reset = 0x04)
Comparator mode mask - only for ADS1114 and ADS1115 - (default at reset = 0x00)
Comparator polarity mask - only for ADS1114 and ADS1115 - (default at reset = 0x00)
ALERT/RDY pin is low when active (default)
ALERT/RDY pin is high when active
Latching comparator mode mask of ALERT/RDY pins - only for ADS1114 and ADS1115 - (default at reset = 0x00)
Comparator queue and disable mask - only for ADS1114 and ADS1115 - (default at reset = 0x03)
Disable the comparator and put ALERT/RDY in high state (default)

briefdescription.para: Possible gain values.

detaileddescription.para:
Voltages over the gain limit will saturate the conversion (i.e. converted value will be the same of the gain limit).
Never use input voltages greater than 5V.

briefdescription.para: Read an ADS1X15 register.

simplesect.para: The value of the addressed register.

briefdescription.para: Writes to ADS1X15 config register.
Checks if there is data available to read.

simplesect.para: True if no conversion is being done and the value is ready to be read. Otherwise, false.

briefdescription.para: Reads the binary voltage requested when it is ready.

detaileddescription.para: To use when in continuous mode. Same as ads1x15_readNext().

briefdescription.para: Reads the binary voltage requested when it is ready.

detaileddescription.para: To use when in continuous mode.

briefdescription.para: Reads channel binary voltage.

parameterdescription.para: Channel to read. Must be in 0, 1, 2 or 3.

simplesect.para: Binary representation of the voltage in the channel.

briefdescription.para: Reads differential voltage in binary mode between channels 0(+) and 1(-).

detaileddescription.para: Reads 16 or 12 bits representation of the difference between the voltage in channels 0(+) and 1(-).

simplesect.para: Binary representation of the differential voltage.

briefdescription.para: Reads differential voltage in binary mode between channels 2(+) and 3(-).

detaileddescription.para: Reads 16 or 12 bits representation of the difference between the voltage in channels 2(+) and 3(-).

simplesect.para: Binary representation of the differential voltage.

memberdef.argsstring: (ads1x15_config_t *config_ptr, uint8_t channel, int16_t highThreshold, int16_t lowThreshold)
memberdef.name: ads1x15_setComparator

briefdescription.para: Sets the ADS1X15 in comparator mode.

detaileddescription.para: In comparator mode, the ADS1X15 sets the ALERT/RDY pin to LOW when the voltage read exceed a high threshold. This pin is set to HIGH again when the voltage read falls below a low threshold. The ALERT/RDY pin is connected to arduino D3 pin.

briefdescription.para: Turns comparator mode off.

detaileddescription.para: Note that comparator mode needs the continuous mode. So when comparator mode is unset, continuous mode still set. Unset continuous mode too if necessary.

briefdescription.para: Checks if in comparator mode.

simplesect.para: True if comparator mode is active. False if not.

memberdef.argsstring: (ads1x15_config_t *config_ptr, uint8_t channel, int16_t highThreshold, int16_t lowThreshold)
memberdef.name: ads1x15_startComparator_SingleEnded

briefdescription.para: Sets the high threshold value to comparator mode.

detaileddescription.para: The ADS1115 has a interrupt signal connected to arduino ALERT/RDY pin (D3) to notify voltages over a high threshold. To use this feature, the alert jumper on arduino must be closed and a interrupt handler must be set with attachinterrupt(6, <interruptHandler>, LOW), where <interruptHandler> is the function to be called on interrupt signal.

parameterdescription.para: The channel to keep track of value. Must be in 0, 1, 2 or 3.
The high threshold set ALERT/RDY pin LOW.
The low threshold to set ALERT/RDY pin HIGH.

briefdescription.para: Sets the library to work on continuous mode.

detaileddescription.para: In continuous mode, the library will reads the voltage value based on a sample rate. For example, if reading at 860Hz, then 860 measures will be done in a second.

parameterdescription.para: True to activate continuous mode, false to deactivate continuous mode.

briefdescription.para: Checks if in continuous mode.

simplesect.para: Ture if in continuous mode, false if not.

briefdescription.para: Sets the input gain.

detaileddescription.para: The input gain is used to adjust the converter resolution to the signal magnitude. Greater gains adjusts lower voltages over the resolution.

parameterdescription.para: A available gain from the Gain_t enumerator.

briefdescription.para: Gets the gain set on the ADS1X15.
[brief description]
Sets the conversor sample rate on continuous mode.

parameterdescription.para:
Sample rate. Possible values are:
If using Nanoshield_ADC12 (12 bits): 128, 250, 490, 920, 1600, 2400, 3300
If using Nanoshield_ADC (16 bits): 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, 250, 475, 860 If no one of the above, the closest lower value will be selected.

briefdescription.para: Gets actual ADS1X15 sample rate.
Reads channel current from 4mA to 20mA.

parameterdescription.para: Channel to read. Must be one of 0, 1, 2 or 3.

simplesect.para: The current on channel from 4mA to 20mA.

briefdescription.para: Reads channel voltage.

parameterdescription.para: Channel to read. Must be one of 0, 1, 2 or 3.

briefdescription.para: Reads voltage in differential mode between channels 0(+) and 1(-).

detaileddescription.para: Reads the difference between voltages in channel 0(+) and 1(-). For example, if the voltage in both channels is the same, then the differential voltage is zero. Notice that the voltage margin in channels still 0V to 5V in relation to GND.

simplesect.para: The difference between the voltages in channel 0(+) and 1(-).

briefdescription.para: Reads voltage in differential mode between channels 2(+) and 3(-).

detaileddescription.para: Reads the difference between voltages in channel 2(+) and 3(-). For example, if the voltage in both channels is the same, then the differential voltage is zero. Notice that the voltage margin in channels still 0V to 5V in relation to GND.

simplesect.para: The difference between the voltages in channel 2(+) and 3(-).
